manifest.title: Traccar
manifest.author: Traccar developers
manifest.description:
## About

Traccar is an open source GPS tracking system. This repository contains Java-based back-end service. It supports more than 200 GPS protocols and more than 2000 models of GPS tracking devices. Traccar can be used with any major SQL database system. It also provides easy to use REST API.

## Features

Some of the available features include:

* Real-time GPS tracking
* Driver behaviour monitoring
* Detailed and summary reports
* Geofencing functionality
* Alarms and notifications
* Account and device management
* Email and SMS support
manifest.changelog:
* Update traccar to 6.11.1
* [Full Changelog](https://www.traccar.org/blog/traccar-6-11/)
* breaking: Removed legacy authentication method  
* feature: Added support for new device protocol  
* fix: Resolved issue with GPS data parsing  
* fix: Corrected server startup error on Windows  
* fix: Fixed memory leak in connection handler  
* fix: Addressed UI glitch in device management panel  
* fix: Patched security vulnerability in API endpoint

change-default-password.message: Change the admin email and password credentials

manifest.postInstallMessage:
This app is pre-setup with an admin account. The initial credentials are: **Username**: admin@cloudron.local
**Password**: admin
By default, Cloudron users have regular users permissions. Permissions can be updated on the user profile page in the admin back-end.
